describe: Ivory Coast, also known as C√¥te d'Ivoire, is a West African country known for its diverse cultures, vibrant cities, and lush landscapes. It is a leading producer of cocoa beans and has a rich history reflected in its colonial architecture and traditional villages.

cities.name: üèù Abidjan
cities.geographical_location: Located on the southern Atlantic coast of Ivory Coast.
cities.climate: Tropical wet and dry climate with a long rainy season from May to July.
cities.famous_cuisine: Atti√©k√© (cassava couscous), Alloco (fried plantains), and Garba (tuna and cassava dish).

cities.name: üèù Yamoussoukro
cities.geographical_location: Situated in the central part of Ivory Coast.
cities.climate: Tropical wet and dry climate with a distinct dry season.
cities.famous_cuisine: Kedjenou (slow-cooked chicken stew) and Fufu (starchy side dish).
popular_attractions: Basilica of Our Lady of Peace

cities.name: üèù San Pedro
cities.geographical_location: Located on the southwestern coast of Ivory Coast.
cities.climate: Tropical monsoon climate with heavy rainfall from May to October.
cities.famous_cuisine: Seafood dishes, including grilled fish and shrimp.
